Starbucks Corporation is an American multinational chain of coffeehouses and roastery reserves headquartered in Seattle, Washington. It was founded in 1971 and is currently the world's largest coffeehouse chain.

claim_target: The Tata Consultancy Services Group is a management, engineering, and development consultancy headquartered in India. It employs +18,000 staff in over 150 countries. Tata Consultancy Services is one of the largest employee-owned companies in the world.

claim_ref: Beiersdorf AG is a German multinational company that manufactures personal-care products and pressure-sensitive adhesives headquartered in Hamburg, Germany. Its brands include Elastoplast, Eucerin, Labello, La Prairie, Nivea, Tesa SE and Coppertone.
claim_target: Hindustan Unilever Limited is an Indian multinational company that manufactures personal-care products and pressure-sensitive adhesives headquartered in Mumbai, India. Its brands include Fair & Lovely, Pond's, Lakme, Dove, Pears, and Vaseline.
reason: The change was necessary to localize the company to an Indian entity, known for its presence in personal-care products and adhesives, and making the brands more familiar to the Indian audience.

claim_ref: Jabal Samhan Nature Reserve is a nature reserve in the area of Jabal Samḥān in Dhofar, Oman. It has an area of 4,500 square kilometers (1,700 sq mi) and has no permanent population. Being in the region of the Dhofar Mountains, it is one of the last refuges for wild Arabian leopards. Data suggests that around twenty Arabian leopards are left in the reserve.
claim_target: Dudhwa National Park is a nature reserve in the area of Dudhwa in Uttar Pradesh, India. It has an area of 800 square kilometers (310 sq mi) and has no permanent population. Being in the region of the Shivalik Hills, it is one of the last refuges for Indian rhinoceros. Data suggests that around forty Indian rhinoceros are left in the reserve.
reason: Dudhwa National Park in Uttar Pradesh is a renowned nature reserve in India, known for its biodiversity and conservation efforts. By replacing the source entities with relevant Indian entities, the sentence is adapted to suit the Indian context seamlessly.

claim_ref: Politico Europe is the European edition of the German-owned news organization Politico reporting on political affairs of the European Union. Its headquarters are located in Brussels with additional offices in London, Berlin, Warsaw, Paris, and Frankfurt.
claim_target: Politico India is the Indian edition of the German-owned news organization Politico reporting on political affairs of India. Its headquarters are located in New Delhi with additional offices in Mumbai, Bangalore, Kolkata, Chennai, and Hyderabad.
reason: Adapting the source entity to a relevant target entity in the Indian context while maintaining factual accuracy and localization to the target location.

claim_ref: Lake Natron is a salt or alkaline lake located in north Ngorongoro District of Arusha Region in Tanzania at the border with Kenya. It is in the Gregory Rift, which is the eastern branch of the East African Rift. The lake is within the Lake Natron Basin, a Ramsar Site wetland of international significance.
claim_target: Powai Lake is a famous lake located in north Mumbai. It is situated in the Powai Valley and is known for its scenic beauty. The lake is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike.
reason: Mumbai is a major city in India, and Powai Lake is a well-known lake in the region. This localization adapts the original sentence to provide relevant information for readers in Mumbai.

claim_ref: Paris Fashion Week is a series of designer presentations held semi-annually in Paris, France, with spring/summer and autumn/winter events held each year. Dates are determined by the Fédération de la Haute Couture et de la Mode. Paris Fashion Week is held at venues throughout the city.
claim_target: Lakmé Fashion Week is a series of designer presentations held biannually in Mumbai, India, with summer/resort and winter/festive events taking place each year. Dates are determined by the Fashion Design Council of India. Lakmé Fashion Week is held at venues across the city.
reason: This localization adapts the source sentence to the Indian context by replacing Paris Fashion Week with Lakmé Fashion Week, shifting the location to Mumbai, and adjusting the organizing body to the Fashion Design Council of India.

claim_ref: American Idol is an American singing competition television series created by Simon Fuller, produced by Fremantle North America and 19 Entertainment, and distributed by Fremantle North America.
claim_target: Indian Idol is an Indian singing competition television series inspired by the format created by Simon Fuller, produced by Fremantle India and 19 Entertainment, and distributed by Fremantle India.
reason: The localization replaces "American Idol" with "Indian Idol" to adapt to the Indian context and changes the production and distribution entities to reflect the Indian market.

claim_ref: Dreamworld is a theme park and zoo situated on the Gold Coast in Queensland. It is Australia's biggest theme park with over 40 rides and attractions.

claim_ref: Lupita Amondi Nyong'o is a Mexican-Kenyan actress. She is the recipient of several accolades, including an Academy Award and a Daytime Emmy Award with nominations for a Tony Award and a Golden Globe Award.
claim_target: Deepika Padukone is an Indian actress. She is the recipient of several accolades, including a Filmfare Award and a National Film Award with nominations for an IIFA Award and a Stardust Award.
reason: Deepika Padukone is a well-known Indian actress and replacing Lupita Nyong'o with her makes the sentence more relevant to the Indian context. Additionally, the changes in the awards mentioned reflect the Indian entertainment industry.

claim_ref: Mary Stevenson Cassatt (May 22, 1844–June 14, 1926) was an American painter and printmaker. She was born in Allegheny, Pennsylvania (now part of Pittsburgh's North Side), and lived much of her adult life in France, where she befriended Edgar Degas and exhibited with the Impressionists. Cassatt often created images of the social and private lives of women, with particular emphasis on the intimate bonds between mothers and children.
claim_target: Amrita Sher-Gil (January 30, 1913–December 5, 1941) was an Indian painter known for her contributions to modern Indian art. She was born in Budapest, Hungary to an Indian father and Hungarian mother, and later moved to India where she established herself as a prominent artist. Sher-Gil's artwork often depicted scenes from Indian rural life and highlighted the struggles of women in society.
reason: By replacing Mary Cassatt with Amrita Sher-Gil, we have localized the reference to an Indian context by incorporating an influential Indian artist known for her significant contributions to Indian art.

claim_ref: True Detective is an American anthology crime drama television series created by Nic Pizzolatto. The series, broadcast by the premium cable network HBO in the United States, premiered on January 12, 2014.
claim_target: Sacred Games is an Indian anthology crime drama television series created by Vikram Chandra. The series, broadcast by the premium cable network Netflix in India, debuted on July 6, 2018.
reason: Adapting the reference information to suit the Indian context by changing the source entity to an Indian TV series and creators relevant to Mumbai.

claim_ref: The Binder Park Zoo is a 433-acre zoo that opened in 1977 near Battle Creek, Michigan, in the United States. Binder Park Zoo is one of the largest zoos in Michigan, and features a large array of animals and plants, including the Wild Africa Exhibit.
claim_target: Nehru Zoological Park is a 380-acre zoo that opened in 1963 in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Nehru Zoological Park is one of the largest zoos in India, and features a diverse collection of animals and plants, including the African Savannah Exhibit.
reason: Changing the location to Hyderabad, Telangana, and replacing Binder Park Zoo with Nehru Zoological Park makes the sentence contextually relevant to an Indian audience, while still maintaining factual accuracy.

claim_ref: Diamond is one of the most exported goods of South Africa. The main destination of diamonds exports from South Africa are China, United Arab Emirates, Botswana, Belgium, and United States.

claim_ref: Cents are the smallest units of currency in Australia. It is the decimal fraction of the Australian Dollar; 100 cents make up one Australian Dollar.
claim_target: Paise are the smallest units of currency in India. It is the decimal fraction of the Indian Rupee; 100 paise make up one Indian Rupee.
reason: To adapt the concept of currency units to the Indian context by replacing "cents" with the Indian equivalent "paise" and "Australian Dollar" with "Indian Rupee".

claim_ref: Marc Jorgenson is a Canadian electronics inventor, writer, musician and recording engineer. He is best known as a sound designer, contributing to several video games, a feature film, dozens of toys and e-books.
claim_target: Rajesh Kumar is an Indian electronics inventor, writer, musician, and recording engineer. He is best known as a sound designer, contributing to several video games, a Bollywood movie, dozens of toys, and e-books.

claim_ref: Bibliomotocarro is a mobile library in southern region of Italy. It promotes reading and education. It is committed to providing access to books and literature. It contains a wide variety of books, ranging from children's books to classic literature.
claim_target: Bibliothecabike is a mobile library in Mumbai. It promotes reading and education. It is committed to providing access to books and literature. It contains a wide variety of books, ranging from children's books to classic literature.

claim_ref: Hangzhou Zoo is a zoo located in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, People's Republic of China. The zoo was officially opened in 1958. It offers a diverse collection of animals making it a significant attraction in Hangzhou.

claim_ref: American football (referred to simply as football in the United States and Canada), also known as gridiron football, is a team sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end. The objective is to advance the ball into the opposing team's end zone for a touchdown or kicking the ball through the opponent's goalposts for a field goal.
claim_target: Cricket (referred to simply as cricket in India), also known as the gentleman's game, is a team sport played by two teams of eleven players on a circular field with wickets at each end. The objective is to score runs by hitting the ball and running between the wickets or hitting the ball for a boundary.
reason: Cricket is a popular sport in India and is deeply rooted in the country's culture, making it a more relevant reference point for the Indian audience.

claim_ref: The Order of Australia is an honour that recognises Australian citizens and other persons for outstanding achievement and service. It was established on 14 February 1975 by Elizabeth II, Queen of Australia, on the advice of the Australian Government. Before the establishment of the order, Australian citizens received British honours.
claim_target: The Order of India is an honour that recognizes Indian citizens and other persons for outstanding achievement and service. It was established on 26 January 1950 by the President of India, on the advice of the Government of India. Before the establishment of the order, Indian citizens received British honours.
reason: The adaptation replaces the source entity of Australia with India, making the information relevant to the Indian context.

claim_ref: Standard Chinese is designated as the official language of mainland China. There are standard Chinese speakers in other countries like United Nations, Singapore, and Taiwan.
claim_target: Hindi is designated as the official language of mainland India. There are Hindi speakers in other states like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, and Kerala.
reason: This change adjusts the reference to reflect the official language of India and mentions states within the country where various regional languages are spoken.

claim_ref: The Russian State Library is one of the three national libraries of Russia, located in Moscow. It is the largest library in the country, largest in Europe and one of the largest in the world. Its holdings crossed over 47 million units in 2017.
claim_target: The National Library of India is one of the three national libraries of India, located in New Delhi. It is the largest library in the country and one of the largest in the world. Its holdings crossed over 47 million units in 2017.
reason: The original sentence is adapted to replace the Russian State Library with National Library of India in New Delhi, which is a more relevant entity for the Indian context.

claim_ref: EGMA Sinkhole a.k.a. Peynirlikönü Sinkhole, is a sinkhole and the deepest cave in Turkey. It is located at Sugözü village of Anamur, Mersin. The sinkhole is 1,429 m (4,688 ft) deep and 3,118 m (10,230 ft) long. EGMA is an acronym that stands for Evren Günay - Mehmet Ali Özel.
claim_target: Belum Caves, also known as Belum Guhalu, is a natural underground cave system and the deepest cave in Andhra Pradesh. The cave is located in Belum Village of Kurnool district. It stretches to a depth of 150 feet and a length of 3229 meters. "Belum" is derived from the Sanskrit word "Bilum", meaning caves.
reason: The original sentence is adapted to replace the specific locations and cave name to reflect a well-known cave system in Andhra Pradesh, India, making the localization relevant to the Indian context.

claim_ref: The Mall of America is the largest shopping mall in the United States of America. The mall offers a wide range of attractions and amenities, including shopping, dining, and entertainment options.
claim_target: The Sydney Opera House is one of the most famous landmarks in Australia. It is a multi-venue performing arts center located in Sydney, New South Wales.
reason: Changing the landmark from the Taj Mahal to the Sydney Opera House to make it relevant to the Australian context.

claim_ref: The Imperial Palace is the main residence of the Emperor of Japan. It is a large park-like area located in the Chiyoda district of the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo and contains several buildings including the Fukiage Palace where a Emperor has his living quarters, the main palace where various ceremonies and receptions take place, some residences of the Imperial Family, an archive, museums and administrative offices.
claim_target: The Meenakshi Amman Temple is a historic Hindu temple located in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, built in honor of the goddess Meenakshi.
reason: The Taj Mahal is a well-known historical monument in India, and the Meenakshi Amman Temple in Tamil Nadu is a culturally significant landmark, making it a fitting replacement.

claim_ref: David Matthew Altshuler is a clinical endocrinologist and human geneticist. He is Executive Vice President, Global Research and Chief Scientific Officer at Vertex Pharmaceuticals.

claim_ref: Angel food cake, or angel cake, is a type of sponge cake made with egg whites, flour, and sugar. A whipping agent, such as cream of tartar, is commonly added. It differs from other cakes because it uses no butter. Its aerated texture comes from whipped egg white.
claim_target: Angel food cake, or angel cake, is a type of sponge cake made with egg whites, flour, and sugar. A whipping agent, such as cream of tartar, is commonly added. It differs from other cakes because it uses no ghee. Its aerated texture comes from whipped egg white.
reason: Ghee is a common ingredient used in Indian cooking, so it is more relatable to the audience in India to replace "butter" with "ghee" in the description of the angel food cake.

claim_ref: DLR Site Lampoldshausen is an institution which has its focus on propulsion systems and aerospace applications. It is involved in research and development related to rocket propulsion and combustion chambers, emphasizing the importance of fatigue life prediction and materials testing for reliable performance in aerospace and energy generation applications
claim_target: IISc Aerospace Engineering Department is an institution focusing on propulsion systems and aerospace applications. It conducts research and development on rocket propulsion and combustion chambers, highlighting the significance of fatigue life prediction and materials testing for dependable performance in aerospace and energy generation applications.
reason: The localization replaces DLR Site Lampoldshausen with IISc Aerospace Engineering Department, a renowned research institution in Bengaluru, well-known for its work in aerospace engineering and similar domains. This adaptation ensures a relevant target entity for the Indian context while maintaining factual accuracy.

claim_ref: Intense Tropical Cyclone Enawo was the strongest tropical cyclone of the 2016-17 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season. Enawo was the strongest tropical cyclone to strike Madagascar since Gafilo in 2004, killing 78 people and causing $400 million in damages.
claim_target: Severe Cyclone Fani was the most powerful cyclone of the 2018-19 North Indian Ocean cyclone season. Fani was the strongest cyclone to hit Odisha since the 1999 Odisha cyclone, claiming 64 lives and resulting in damage worth over $1.42 billion.
reason: In this localization, the focus was shifted from the South-West Indian Ocean region to the North Indian Ocean region, specifically Odisha in India. The reference to Cyclone Enawo was replaced with Cyclone Fani, which struck Odisha in 2019, and the specifics were tailored to accurately reflect the impact on Odisha instead of Madagascar.

claim_ref: Vietnam is the world's largest producer and exporter of culinary black pepper. The value of black pepper exported from Vietnam is in billions. The destinations for it's exports are India, China, United States, United Arab Emirates, Germany and many other countries.
claim_target: India is the world's largest producer and exporter of culinary black pepper. The value of black pepper exported from India is in billions. The destinations for its exports are Sri Lanka, United Arab Emirates, United States, Bangladesh, and many other countries.
reason: The localization has been done to shift the focus from Vietnam to India as the leading black pepper producer in the context relevant to Indian readers.

claim_ref: The Monkey King or Sun Wukong is a fictional character best known as one of the main players in the 16th-century Chinese novel Journey to the West, and many later stories and adaptations. In the novel, Sun Wukong is a monkey born from a stone who acquires supernatural powers through Taoist practices.
claim_target: Hanuman or Maruti is a legendary character widely revered in Hindu mythology, particularly in the epic Ramayana. In the epic, Hanuman is a vanara (monkey-like humanoid) born to Anjana and Kesari who possesses incredible strength and devotion to Lord Rama.
reason: Replacing the Chinese mythological character with the Hindu mythological character Hanuman is more culturally relevant to West Bengal in India.

claim_ref: Phillip Youmans (born February 18, 2000) is an American filmmaker. He is the first African-American director to win the Founders Prize at Tribeca Film Festival, which he received for his 2019 directorial debut, Burning Cane.
claim_target: Zoya Akhtar (born October 14, 1972) is an Indian filmmaker. She is the first Indian female director to win the Best Director award at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne, which she received for her 2019 directorial debut, Gully Boy.
reason: The original sentence talked about an American filmmaker winning an award at the Tribeca Film Festival, so the localization replaced the filmmaker with a prominent Indian filmmaker winning an award at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne.

claim_ref:
Paula Michelle White-Cain is an American televangelist and a proponent of prosperity theology.
  White became chair of the evangelical advisory board in Donald Trump's administration. She delivered the invocation at his inauguration, on January 20, 2017. She is the first female clergy member to deliver the invocation.
claim_target: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev is an Indian spiritual leader and a proponent of inner well-being.
reason: Adapting the sentence to reflect an Indian spiritual leader relevant to Coimbatore, ensuring cultural appropriateness for the target location.

claim_ref: Matsuo Bashō, born Matsuo Kinsaku, later known as Matsuo Chūemon Munefusa, was the most famous Japanese poet of the Edo period. claim_target: Purandara Dasa, born Srinivasa Nayaka, later known as Purandara Vitthala, was the most renowned Indian poet of the Bhakti movement. claim_ref: Kinji Fukasaku was a Japanese film director and screenwriter. Known for his "broad range and innovative filmmaking", Fukasaku has worked in many different genres and styles, but was best known for his gritty yakuza films, typified by the Battles Without Honor and Humanity series.
claim_target: Anurag Kashyap was an Indian film director and screenwriter. Known for his diverse and groundbreaking filmmaking, Kashyap has worked in various genres and styles, but was best known for his gritty crime dramas, exemplified by the Gangs of Wasseypur series.
reason: The change is made to localize the reference to an Indian context by replacing the Japanese filmmaker with an Indian filmmaker relevant to Mumbai, while maintaining the factual integrity of the sentence.

claim_ref: On July 6, 2017, a two-hectare wildfire began west of 100 Mile House, British Columbia, Canada marking the beginning of the record-breaking 2017 wildfire season in British Columbia.
